thread.title: Hip Hop Single Sales: Migos, Machine Gun Kelly & Bruno Mars
thread.title_full: Hip Hop Single Sales: Migos, Machine Gun Kelly & Bruno Mars

author: Henry Mansell
title: Hip Hop Single Sales: Migos, Machine Gun Kelly & Bruno Mars
text:
0 
New York City, NY – This week on the R&B/Hip Hop single sales chart, Migos’ “Bad And Boujee” remains at #1 for the second consecutive week, despite significant gains from Machine Gun Kelly with his single “Bad Things.” Elsewhere this week, Big Sean’s “Bounce Back” returns to the Top 10 and lastly, Aminé’s “Caroline” slips to #12 following a 9% dip in week-on-week sales. Migos Stays At #1 
Migos’ single “Bad And Boujee” remains glued to the top of the charts this week. The cut, which features Lil Uzi Vert and is produced by Metro Boomin, sold 67,836 units during the seven days leading to January 19. Keep in mind, these stats were still from before the full release of the Culture album . Machine Gun Kelly Jumps To #2 
Despite a 6% decrease in sales, Machine Gun Kelly’s single “Bad Things,” featuring former Fifth Harmony member Camila Cabello, jumps one place to #2 this week. The cut sold 46,347 units during the seven days leading to January 19. Bruno Mars Falls 
A 16% decrease in sales leaves Bruno Mars’ “24K Magic” at #3 this week. The single sold 45,801 units during the seven days leading to January 19, tipping its total sales over the one million mark to 1,008,141 copies. The Top 10 R&B/Hip Hop Single Sales For Week Ending 01/19/2017
